channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Jailed former Pakistan PM Imran Khan booked for inciting official to mutiny
item.description: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan has been charged with inciting government officers to mutiny and creating chaos. The Federal Investigation Agency is investigating his social media accounts for posts that allegedly undermine national security. This follows a controversial post comparing past and present military leaderships and urging review of a judicial commission report.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran successfully launches research satellite, sparks Western concerns
item.description: Iran launched the Chamran-1 research satellite into orbit using a rocket developed by the Revolutionary Guard. The satellite aims to test space hardware and software. This is Iran's second launch this year, raising Western concerns about potential ballistic missile development, which Iran denies. The launch coincides with heightened regional tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: What Harris and Trump say about each other
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mexico City water plague: Photos depict residents living for over a month in black sewage water
item.description: Mexico City water plague: Photos depict residents living for over a month in black sewage water

item.title: Trump distances himself from Laura Loomer’s racist remarks after backlash: 'I disagree with her statements'
item.description: Donald Trump defended far-right activist Laura Loomer following her racist comments about Kamala Harris, clarifying she does not work for his 2024 campaign but is a supporter. While distancing himself from her statements, he praised her passion and criticized Democratic leaders during his California tour.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JK Rowling slams Indian-origin trans executive over rape crisis centre failings
item.description: JK Rowling has condemned Mridul Wadhwa, the former CEO of Edinburgh Rape Crisis Centre, after a report revealed significant failures in safeguarding women-only spaces. Wadhwa resigned following an investigation that found she lacked professional standards. The ERCC board has committed to implementing recommendations to enhance their services and protect women-only spaces.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police fatally shoot man hiding in bathtub in Brooklyn apartment
item.description: Jean Baptiste, 38, was fatally shot by Brooklyn police while serving a bench warrant. He was wanted for three murders and found hiding in a bathtub with a knife. After an ineffective Taser attempt and an alleged attack on an officer, police used deadly force. The incident is under investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘If Prince Harry got an ounce of brain, he won’t ... ’: Royal commentator warns
item.description: Prince Harry's upcoming 40th birthday celebration has raised concerns due to his notorious past. Experts advise caution to avoid upsetting Meghan Markle, recalling his infamous 2012 Las Vegas trip. With Meghan staying home with their children during the festivities, all eyes are on how Harry will balance celebration and family responsibilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Overwork obesity': 996 work culture causes Chinese woman to gain 20kg in a year
item.description: Ouyang Wenjing, a 24-year-old from Guangdong province, gained 20kg over the past year due to work-related stress. She cited long hours and irregular shifts as contributing factors. After quitting her job in June, she saw improvements in her well-being. Experts recommend a balanced diet and regular exercise to counteract 'overwork obesity.'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris drives 400,000+ to vote.gov: Can celebrity influence swing US election?
item.description: Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris has stirred significant interest and could impact the US presidential election. Her Instagram post resulted in a surge in voter registrations, particularly among young voters. Harris's campaign aims to capitalize on this momentum, potentially involving Swift further in key battleground states like Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden clashes with journalist over Putin's war threat amid Ukraine tensions: 'Be quite'
item.description: President Joe Biden rebuked a journalist for pressing him about Russian President Vladimir Putin’s warning on Ukraine. During a meeting with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, Biden dismissed concerns over Putin's threat that lifting restrictions on Ukraine’s use of long-range missiles could escalate the conflict into a direct US-Russia war.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China says German naval ships in Taiwan Strait 'increase security risks'
item.description: China on Saturday accused Berlin of heightening security risks in the Taiwan Strait, a day after two German vessels sailed through the sensitive waters. "The German side's behaviour increases security risks and sends incorrect signals," Chinese military spokesperson Li Xi said in a statement.

item.title: ‘Modern bird wings first appeared in the archaeopteryx 145 million years ago — they haven’t changed much’
item.description: Palaeontologist Nick Longrich investigates the evolution of flight in dinosaurs, focusing on rare events that led to avian flight. His research on the archaeopteryx provides new insights into early bird wings and their development over millions of years, revealing how some adaptations have remained unchanged for 100 million years.

item.title: ‘The wings of huge pterosaurs and tiny bees differ — but they both produce thrust and lift’
Kamala Harris reveals she's a gun owner during debate with Donald Trump: What does it mean?
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris revealed she owns a handgun for personal safety during a debate, aiming to counter Republican claims about Democrats wanting to confiscate firearms. Harris seeks to bridge the gap between advocating for stricter gun regulations and addressing the concerns of gun owners, navigating the complex landscape of American gun politics.

item.title: Donald Trump on another debate with Kamala Harris: 'Maybe, if I got in the right mood ... '
item.description: Donald Trump hinted at reconsidering a second debate with Kamala Harris if he's in the right mood, emphasising his lead in polls and criticising the Biden-Harris administration. He dismissed a third debate, urging Harris to focus on her responsibilities over the past four years. Both are official presidential nominees for their parties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Michaela DePrince? Ballet icon who overcame civil war and orphanhood dies at 29
item.description: Michaela DePrince, a distinguished ballerina who triumphed over severe childhood adversities in Sierra Leone to achieve prominence as a second-soloist with the Boston Ballet, has died at 29. Besides her ballet career, she advocated for children impacted by war and appeared in notable documentaries and music videos.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Life's too short': US man purchases $395,000 cliffside home despite warnings that it might erode into the ocean
item.description: David Moot, an American interior painter and designer, acquired a cliffside home on Cape Cod for $395,000 despite warnings about coastal erosion. The three-bedroom house sits only 7.6 metres from a deteriorating cliff. This purchase exemplifies a growing trend of buying scenic properties at significant discounts amid climate change concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Lessons learned': Stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore on Boeing's return to earth
item.description: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore shared their relief after the Boeing Starliner spacecraft safely landed in New Mexico. During a live press conference from the ISS, they discussed their extended mission, lessons learned, and upcoming handover to Expedition 72 astronauts Nick and Alex. The astronauts are scheduled to return to Earth aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon in February.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Elijah Vue? Skeletal remains of missing 3-year-old found in Wisconsin
item.description: Elijah Vue, a three-year-old boy from Wisconsin Dells, vanished in February while under the care of his mother's boyfriend, Jesse Vang. His skeletal remains were found in September near Two Rivers. The community is devastated by the loss. Both his mother and Vang face child neglect charges but have pleaded not guilty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
